title: Suneet Chopra
text:
Suneet Chopra is an Indian <a href="Communism">communist</a> politician and <a href="trade%20union">trade union</a>ist. He was the All India Joint Secretary of the <a href="All%20India%20Agricultural%20Workers%20Union">All India Agricultural Workers Union</a>. He was a <a href="Central%20Committee">Central Committee</a> member of the <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India%20%28Marxist%29">Communist Party of India (Marxist)</a>.
Earlier he was in the Central Committee of the <a href="Students%20Federation%20of%20India">Students Federation of India</a> and a founder member of the SFI in <a href="Jawaharlal%20Nehru%20University%2C%20Delhi">Jawaharlal Nehru University</a> New Delhi, Later in 1980 he was the founder All India treasurer of the <a href="Democratic%20Youth%20Federation%20of%20India">Democratic Youth Federation of India</a> and became the <a href="Vice-President">Vice-President</a> in 1984. Chopra was born on 24 December 1941 in <a href="Lahore">Lahore</a>. He is also an art critic, writer and poet. He is an alumnus of <a href="Modern%20School%20%28New%20Delhi%29">Modern School</a> and <a href="St.%20Columba%27s%20School%2C%20Delhi">St. Columba's School, Delhi</a>, and <a href="St.%20Xavier%27s%20College%2C%20Calcutta">St. Xavier's College, Calcutta</a>. He taught science at <a href="Holland%20Park%20School">Holland Park School</a>. He read African studies at the <a href="School%20of%20Oriental%20and%20African%20Studies">School of Oriental and African Studies</a>, <a href="University%20of%20London">University of London</a> and later regional development at Jawaharlal Nehru University in New Delhi.He supports communism in India.
